questions.question_text: In order to enable FlexVPN to use a AAA attribute list, which two tasks must be performed? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Assign the list to an authorization policy.
choices.B: Verify that clients are using the correct authorization policy.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
Extended Hub Configuration for Client1

 Define a AAA attribute list.

 aaa attribute list Client1
 attribute type interface-config "ip mtu 1300" protocol ip
 attribute type interface-config "service-policy output TEST" protocol ip

 Note: Remember that the entity assigned via attributes must exist locally. In this case, policy-map was previously configured.

 policy-map TEST
 class class-default
 shape average 60000

 Assign AAA attribute list to an authorization policy.

 crypto ikev2 authorization policy Client1
 pool FlexSpokes
 aaa attribute list Client1
 route set interface

Selected Answer: BD
It's B&D, it says to ENABLE FlexVPN to use a AAA attribute list, which implies AAA list already exists.

To enable FlexVPN to use a AAA attribute list, the two tasks that must be performed are: 1. Defining the AAA server: You need to define the AAA server configuration on the FlexVPN server, which includes specifying the server's IP address, shared secret, and other relevant settings. This ensures that the FlexVPN server can communicate with the AAA server for authentication, authorization, and accounting purposes. 2. Assigning the list to an authorization policy: Once the AAA server is defined, you need to assign the AAA attribute list to an authorization policy on the FlexVPN server. This authorization policy determines the access privileges for clients connecting to the VPN. By assigning the list to the policy, you can enforce specific attributes or rules defined in the AAA attribute list. These two tasks, defining the AAA server and assigning the AAA attribute list to an authorization policy, are essential for enabling FlexVPN to utilize the AAA attribute list for authentication and authorization purposes.

Selected Answer: CD
The question says what have to be done in order to ENABLE Flex VPN to use AAA list... Verify that clients are using the AAA list is not enabling nothing.... So I would go with C and D.
I will go with C and D, makes more sense

Selected Answer: BD
B and D are correct
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/flexvpn/116032-flexvpn-aaa-config-example-00.html

choices.A: Telnet bookmark via the Telnet plugin
choices.C: VNC bookmark via the VNC plugin
choices.B: RDP2 bookmark via the RDP2 plugin
choices.E: SSH bookmark via the SSH plugin

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B & C

questions.question_text:
An engineer must configure remote desktop connectivity for offsite admins via clientless SSL VPN, configured on a Cisco ASA to Windows Vista workstations.
Which two configurations provide the requested access? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Tiptonlad, it would not be a clientless VPN solution if you did a direct NAT, your comment is wrong.

Selected Answer: A
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/asa-5500-x-series-next-generation-firewalls/111007-smart-tunnel-asa-00.html

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/asa-5500-x-series-next-generation-firewalls/111007-smart-tunnel-asa-00.html

Answer correct is A

A smart tunnel is a connection between a TCP-based application and a private site, using a clientless (browser-based) SSL VPN session with the security appliance as the pathway and the security appliance as a proxy server.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/asa-5500-x-series-next-generation-firewalls/111007-smart-tunnel-asa-00.html

Selected Answer: B
The best option here would be to use a NAT address so the server is reachable. Other options would not work if a clientless VPN deployment is being used.

comments.content: bro that answer is totally out of sight...why would NAT for a clientless VPN

questions.question_text: A network engineer must design a clientless VPN solution for a company. VPN users must be able to access several internal web servers. When reachability to those web servers was tested, it was found that one website is not being rewritten correctly by the ASA. What is a potential solution for this issue while still allowing it to be a clientless VPN setup?

choices.A: Set up a smart tunnel with the IP address of the web server.
choices.D: Set up a WebACL to permit the IP address of the web server.
choices.B: Set up a NAT rule that translates the ASA public address to the web server private address on port 80.
choices.C: Set up Cisco AnyConnect with a split tunnel that has the IP address of the web server.

questions.question_text: Which two types of SSO functionality are available on the Cisco ASA without any external SSO servers? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
B and E are correct. https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/asa/asa97/configuration/vpn/asa-97-vpn-config/webvpn-configure-users.html#ID-2271-00000069

The auto-signon command is a single sign-on method for users of clientless SSL VPN sessions. It passes the login credentials (username and password) to internal servers for authentication using NTLM authentication, basic authentication, or both. Multiple auto-signon commands can be entered and are processed according to the input order (early commands take precedence).

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/asa/asa916/configuration/vpn/asa-916-vpn-config/webvpn-configure-policy-groups.html#ID-2439-00001438

Selected Answer: C
C is correct
https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/ios-xml/ios/sec_conn_ike2vpn/configuration/15-2mt/sec-cfg-clb-supp.html
